metadata.title: USN-7048-1 -- Vim vulnerability
metadata.description: Suyue Guo discovered that Vim incorrectly handled memory when flushing the typeahead buffer, leading to heap-buffer-overflow. An attacker could  possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-7048-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  vim - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm25 vim-athena - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm25 vim-athena-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm25 vim-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm25 vim-doc - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm25 vim-gnome - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm25 vim-gnome-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm25 vim-gtk - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm25 vim-gtk-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm25 vim-gtk3 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm25 vim-gtk3-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm25 vim-gui-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm25 vim-nox - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm25 vim-nox-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm25 vim-runtime - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm25 vim-tiny - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm25 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
